title._content: [Portrait of Ray Anthony, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Ray Anthony, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Explanation for the famed Anthony leap has been discovered by the Beat. Natural result of the stimulus in photo one is the reaction in photo two. Ray, according to reports, is always getting hot-foots. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 008 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Leapin' Anthony--here's why," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 19 (Sept. 10, 1947), p. 2. Subjects: Anthony, Ray, 1922- Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.00111 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0011
